title: In-plane Black-hole Spin Measurements Suggest Most Gravitational-wave Mergers Form in Triples
summary: The spin-orbit tilt angles $θ_{1(2)}$ of merging stellar-mass black holes provide key insights into their astrophysical origin. The LIGO, Virgo, and KAGRA Collaborations (2025a, arXiv:2508.18083) report that the spin-orbit tilt distribution of mergers in the latest Gravitational-Wave Transient Catalog 4.0 exhibits a global peak at near-perpendicular directions $\cosθ_{1(2)}\approx0$.
